column4: Magnesium: I can ping the server with the name, and I have tried remounting it with 'sudo mount -a'
But it gives you an error? What error exactly?
well, if I look at it in nautilus, it just hangs forever.  seems to be the same if I try to 'ls' the dir in the terminal.
might be a silly question, but is your networking up? Can you ping google.com?
Yeah.  My internet is acting slow, but I *think* that is an irrelevant issue.
Hmmm...give me a minute, I've got another suggestion comin'
Hmmm....  it seems to be working now, just being unworkably slow.
Okay...good to hear. I thought that might be it, since you weren't getting any errors.
How exactly are you connecting? Do you type smb://whatever into the address bar, or do you mount it to a directory on your computer?
I have it mounted in the fstab via ... smb I believe.
The problem could be on the Windows side...  I'm going to take a quick look at it from a spare windows laptop and see what happens.
Alright...I use the smbmount program to connect to samba shares...i.e., sudo smbmount //sharename /some/path/on/your/computer
Don't know if it's any different
Yeah.  Just looked.  I use "smbfs" in the fstab.  Laptop is booting up...  results in a minute...
Yeah... The windows laptop is bringing up the windows share just as slowly.... Should have known it was a windows problem....  great.  I hate windows problems...
haha...well, you've passed into the dark side...out of reach...
Alright, well thanks for your help.  Wish me luck!
No problem, wish I could have been more help...hope you get it worked out, though! :-)
